docs.snippet: The Christian Advocate and Journal reports the movements of the American Methodist missionaries in India. The Rev. James Baume arrived at Calcutta, July 15, in good health. The Rey. Dr. Butler has fixed his residence at Bareilly.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Christian Advocate and Journal reports the movements of the American Methodist missionaries in India. The Rev. James Baume arrived at Calcutta, July 15, in good health. The Rey. Dr. Butler has fixed his residence at Bareilly.

headline.main: Results of the War Upon the Piggeries.

docs.lead_paragraph: The readers of the TIMES during the past month have been kept well posted with the progress of what was popularly known as the "Piggery War." About the middle of July the Commissioners of Health ordered the abatement of one of greatest nuisances of the City--the pig-pens which abounded in the vicinity of the Central Park.

headline.main: DANIEL WEBSTER.; Dedication of the Statue of Mr. Webster at Boston, Sept. 17. Discourse by Edward Everett on Daniel Webster.

docs.lead_paragraph: At the dedication of the statue of WEBSTER in the State House Grounds in Boston on Saturday, Mr. EVERETT made the following address: May it please Your Excellency: On behalf of those by whose contributions this statue of Mr. WERSTER has been procured,

docs.snippet: HEALTH OF THE CITY--STATE OF THE MARKETS--EXCHANGE. The United States Mail steamship De Soto, J. D. BULLOCH, Commander, from New Orleans via Havana, arrived yesterday morning, having left the latter place on the evening of the 13th. She brings little...
docs.lead_paragraph: HEALTH OF THE CITY--STATE OF THE MARKETS--EXCHANGE. The United States Mail steamship De Soto, J. D. BULLOCH, Commander, from New Orleans via Havana, arrived yesterday morning, having left the latter place on the evening of the 13th. She brings little of interest from Havana.

headline.main: LAW REPORTS.; SUPERIOR COURT. SUPREME COURT- UNITED STATES CIRCUIT COURT. MARINE COURT. COURT OF GENERAL SESSIONS. SUPERIOR COURT

docs.lead_paragraph: SPECIAL NOTICE.--NEW-YORK, Sept. 19. 1859. An entire new Calendar for trials by jury will be made up for the ensuing October, November, and December Terms of this Court. All notes of issue for said Calendar must be filed with the Clerk on or before Saturday, the 24th day of September instant.

headline.main: OUR MEXICAN RELATIONS,; History of the Negotiations--Instructions of the President to Mr. McLane--Prospects of the Treaty. Failure of Mr. McLane to Conclude a Treaty.

docs.lead_paragraph: Your correspondent has made it his specia1 business to penetrate the mystery, or rather the fog, which appears to hang over our relations with Mexico. The result of this investigation causes the writer to state with reluctance that a cloud has come over our negotiations with the Constitutional Government of that country.

headline.main: NEWS BY TELEGRAPH.; INTERESTING FROM WASHINGTON. The British Minister in Costa Rica a Party to the Revolution. The Revolutionary Movements in Carthagena, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: Reliable information received in official circles leaves but little doubt that Sir WM. OUSELEY was a party to the revolution in Costa Rica. Having failed to induce President MORA to assent to the treaty which Nicaragua had rejected, it is believed he then determined to lend his influence to the revolutionary movement.
